ingredients: 2 - 4 cloves of garlic, minced or crushed
1 head cauliflower, chopped into mini florets
1 small cucumber, cubed into 1/2 inch pieces.
instructions: Chop the onion into a medium dice. If mincing the garlic, do that now.
Take out 2 large sauce pans (a wok or sauté pan will work too.) Heat 1.5 tbsp of olive oil in each over medium heat.
Add half the onion to each pot and sauté until just translucent (3-4 min.)
Add half the garlic, za'atar, cumin, and red pepper flakes to each pot and sauté until fragrant (about 1 min.)
Add the cauliflower to 1 pan and cover. Cook until tender and stirring occasionally.
Add the lamb to the other pot and cook until it is just barely pink. Be careful to not overcook it.
While the lamb and cauliflower are cooking, chop the parsley and cucumber and remove the seeds from the pomegranate.
As well, this is a good time to make the yogurt tahini sauce per the link below.
Once the cauliflower and lamb are finished, combine the two pots, mix, and sauté for 1 final minute. Taste to adjust salt/seasoning.
Serve with hummus, pita bread, pomegranate seeds, parsley, yogurt sauce, and cucumber.
